title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: *' There's the tall Wallace Monument/' said Mrs. Pitt, " and the Old Bridge of Stirling, built about 1410, and for centuries the only gateway to the Highlands ; near it Wallace won his greatest victory over the English in September, 1297. It was under that bridge, too, Betty, that David and Allan, in ^ Kidnapped,' hid when they had at length ventured down from the mountains.
